headline: 2 at-large following stabbing at Hamilton mosque: police
context: Police in Hamilton say they’re seaching for two suspects following a stabbing at a downtown mosque on Friday afternoon.
The incident happened at the Hamilton Downtown Mosque at 221 York Blvd., near Queen Street North.

annotations.paragraph: Hamilton Police Service (HPS) said at around 2:15 p.m. they received reports that “several” people had been stabbed following a fight.
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the timing and nature of the incident.

annotations.paragraph: In a news release, they said that the altercation is believed to have started outside the place of worship and continued inside the building.
annotations.reason: Offers important context about where the altercation began and how it progressed.

annotations.paragraph: One person was taken to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, while another was treated at the scene, HPS said, adding that a third victim showed up at the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
annotations.reason: Details the condition of the victims, which is crucial information.

annotations.paragraph: Police say the suspects and the victims were “known to each other.”
annotations.reason: Provides relevant information about the relationship between the suspects and victims.

annotations.paragraph: Two suspects fled the scene in an unknown direction.
annotations.reason: Describes the suspects' actions following the incident, which is directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: “There are conflicting reports whether it was one or two separate vehicles,” investigators said.
annotations.reason: This provides new information about the investigation details.

annotations.paragraph: Police have not released any suspect descriptions at this point.
annotations.reason: This is relevant as it informs about the current status of the investigation.

annotations.paragraph: They are also saying that at this point in the investigation, they do not believe that this incident is hate-motivated.
annotations.reason: This provides important context about the nature of the crime.

annotations.paragraph: “The investigation is ongoing, and police are appealing to anyone with information to come forward,” HPS said.
annotations.reason: This is a standard appeal for information, common in police investigations.

annotations.paragraph: Anyone with information is asked to contact Det. Kersgens at 905-546-3816 or Crime Stoppers anonymously.
annotations.reason: This is a standard call for public assistance, not directly related to the core story.

annotations.paragraph: The Muslim Advisory Council of Canada says it is aware of this incident, is in communication with Hamilton Police and the masjid.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the response from a community organization regarding the incident.
